Package com.intellij.psi

Interface PsiElementFactory

  • All Superinterfaces:
    JVMElementFactory, PsiJavaParserFacade
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PsiElementFactoryImpl

    public interface PsiElementFactory
extends PsiJavaParserFacade, JVMElementFactory
    Service for creating instances of Java and JavaDoc PSI elements which don't have an underlying source code file.
    See Also:
    JavaPsiFacade.getElementFactory(), PsiFileFactory

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  PsiElementFactory.SERVICE
      Deprecated. 
      please use PsiElementFactory.SERVICE.getInstance(Project)

      • createType

        PsiClassType createType(PsiClass resolve,
                        PsiSubstitutor substitutor,
                        LanguageLevel languageLevel)
        Creates a class type for the specified class, using the specified substitutor to replace generic type parameters on the class.
        Specified by:
        createType in interface JVMElementFactory
        Parameters:
        languageLevel - to memorize language level for allowing/prohibiting boxing/unboxing.
        resolve - the class for which the class type is created.
        substitutor - the substitutor to use.
        Returns:
        the class type instance.

        PsiJavaCodeReferenceElement createReferenceElementByFQClassName(java.lang.String qName,
                                                                GlobalSearchScope resolveScope)
        Creates a reference element resolving to the class with the specified name in the specified search scope. The text of the created reference is the short name of the class.

      • createFQClassNameReferenceElement

        PsiJavaCodeReferenceElement createFQClassNameReferenceElement(java.lang.String qName,
                                                              GlobalSearchScope resolveScope)
        Creates a reference element resolving to the class with the specified name in the specified search scope. The text of the created reference is the fully qualified name of the class.

      • createVariableDeclarationStatement

        PsiDeclarationStatement createVariableDeclarationStatement(java.lang.String name,
                                                           PsiType type,
                                                           PsiExpression initializer)
                                                    throws IncorrectOperationException
        Creates a local variable declaration statement with the specified name, type and initializer, optionally without reformatting the declaration.

        Note that depending on code style settings the resulting variable may be declared as final.

        Throws:
        IncorrectOperationException - if name is not a valid identifier or type is not a valid type.

      • createVariableDeclarationStatement

        PsiDeclarationStatement createVariableDeclarationStatement(java.lang.String name,
                                                           PsiType type,
                                                           PsiExpression initializer,
                                                           PsiElement context)
                                                    throws IncorrectOperationException
        Creates a local variable declaration statement with the specified name, type and initializer, optionally without reformatting the declaration.

        Note that depending on code style settings the resulting variable may be declared as final.

        Parameters:
        context - the context used to resolve symbols in the resulting declaration.
        Throws:
        IncorrectOperationException - if name is not a valid identifier or type is not a valid type.

      • getArrayClass

        PsiClass getArrayClass(LanguageLevel languageLevel)
        Returns a synthetic Java class containing methods which are defined on Java arrays.
        Parameters:
        languageLevel - language level used to construct array class.

      • getArrayClassType

        PsiClassType getArrayClassType(PsiType componentType,
                               LanguageLevel languageLevel)
        Returns the class type for a synthetic Java class containing methods which are defined on Java arrays with the specified element type.
        Parameters:
        languageLevel - language level used to construct array class.

                                                     java.lang.String memberName)
                                              throws IncorrectOperationException
        Creates an import static statement for importing the specified member from the specified class.
        Throws:

      • createDummyHolder

        PsiElement createDummyHolder(java.lang.String text,
                             IElementType type,
                             PsiElement context)
        Create a lightweight PsiElement of given element type in a lightweight non-physical PsiFile (aka DummyHolder) in a given context. Element type's language should have a parser definition which supports parsing for this element type (first parameter in PsiParser.parse(IElementType, com.intellij.lang.PsiBuilder).
        Parameters:
        text - text to parse
        type - node type
        context - context
        Returns:
        PsiElement of the desired element type

      • createCatchSection

        PsiCatchSection createCatchSection(PsiType exceptionType,
                                   java.lang.String exceptionName,
                                   PsiElement context)
                            throws IncorrectOperationException
        Creates a catch section for catching an exception of the specified type and name.
        Parameters:
        exceptionType - the type of the exception to catch (either PsiClassType or PsiDisjunctionType).
        exceptionName - the name of the variable in which the caught exception is stored (may be an empty string).
        context - the context for resolving references.
        Throws:
        IncorrectOperationException - if any of the parameters are not valid.

      • createExpressionFromText

        PsiExpression createExpressionFromText(java.lang.String text,
                                       PsiElement context)
                                throws IncorrectOperationException
        Description copied from interface: PsiJavaParserFacade
        Creates a Java expression from the specified text.
        Specified by:
        createExpressionFromText in interface JVMElementFactory
        Specified by:
        createExpressionFromText in interface PsiJavaParserFacade
        Parameters:
        text - the text of the expression to create.
        context - the PSI element used as context for resolving references from the expression.
        Returns:
        the created expression instance.
        Throws:
        IncorrectOperationException - if the text does not specify a valid expression.
